list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Remove unused scripts and image files
This commit deletes several scripts and image files that are no longer needed in the project. The removed scripts were related to MiniGames, System, Pet, MainPage, Gachapon, UI, and Utility. Similarly, several .gif file metadata were removed from the Docs directory, freeing up space and decluttering the codebase.

project.component: { "keyToString": { "ASKED_ADD_EXTERNAL_FILES": "true", "Attach to Unity Editor.Attach to Unity Editor.executor": "Debug", "RunOnceActivity.OpenProjectViewOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "WebServerToolWindowFactoryState": "false", "git-widget-placeholder": "main", "node.js.detected.package.eslint": "true", "node.js.detected.package.tslint": "true", "node.js.selected.package.eslint": "(autodetect)", "node.js.selected.package.tslint": "(autodetect)", "nodejs_package_manager_path": "npm", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "project.propVCSSupport.DirectoryMappings", "vue.rearranger.settings.migration": "true" }, "keyToStringList": { "com.intellij.ide.scratch.ScratchImplUtil$2/New Scratch File": [ "PLAIN_TEXT" ], "rider.external.source.directories": [ "/Users/sy/Library/Application Support/JetBrains/Rider2023.3/resharper-host/DecompilerCache", "/Users/sy/Library/Application Support/JetBrains/Rider2023.3/resharper-host/SourcesCache", "/Users/sy/.local/share/Symbols/src" ] } }

component.name: RunManager
component.selected: Attach to Unity Editor.Attach to Unity Editor & Play

task.summary: Default task
JET BRAINS
character selector
bullet systems

Add new features and refactor code across multiple scripts
Added a GetWeekOfMonth method in MyUtility.cs, created an audio refinement in Gacha_TicketsHolder.cs, and updated the logic of building game stages in Build_GameManager.cs. Significant changes were made to Shoot_GameManager.cs for AI enemy spawning. Unified the instantiation of UI elements to coin2DHolder in MoneyManager.cs, among various other changes in multiple scripts.

Integrate Firebase Analytics and clean up Ads.cs
Implemented Firebase Analytics into Ads.cs for improved tracking. Unused functions such as RewardedVideoOnAdOpenedEvent and unnecessary comments have also been removed. The showRewardedVideo function has been simplified by removing the unneeded "YOUR_PLACEMENT_NAME" argument.

Update .gitignore file
An update has been performed on the .gitignore file to ignore several directories and files. These additions include directories named Editor, ExternalDependencyManager, Feel, Firebase, SFX, _Image, _Localizing, and anim to prevent them from being tracked by git.

Refactor SurfaceMovement2D.cs for cleaner code structure
This commit cleans up SurfaceMovement2D.cs by encapsulating classes within the script. Visibility access modifiers have also been explicitly defined for several methods and variables. The major struct and class definitions have been repositioned to the end of the file for overall improved readability and maintainability.

"Reorganize scripts into UI, Jump, and Shoot categories"
The commit involves moving various scripts into appropriate directories - UI, Jump, and Shoot, to better organize the project. This structure enhances navigation and improves the understanding of the code. The relocation primarily affects the user interface-based scripts alongside those related to the 'Jump' and 'Shoot' functionalities.

Refactor Pet.cs for enhanced readability and efficiency
The code in Pet.cs has been refactored to improve readability and efficiency. This refactoring includes better structuring of the code and consolidation of repeated logic. Additionally, the process of updating and managing animations, particularly for diverse statuses and motions, has been streamlined for more effective handling.

Add PrivateKeys class and update code references
A new PrivateKeys class has been added to store private keys and has been referenced in the Ads script. Unnecessary imports have been removed from Pet and PetDialogueManager scripts, with some small modifications to the PetDialogueManager's accessibility modifiers. These changes aim to improve code readability and security.

Refactor Ads.cs for centralized PlayerPrefs handling
Centralized key variable names used in PlayerPrefs getters and setters in Ads.cs to improve maintainability. Expanded conditions for use of Firebase Analytics and ATTrackingStatusBinding to all non-UNITY_EDITOR modes for more flexibility. Furthermore, preparations for future user data handling extensions have been made.

Refactor audio control and ads system scripts
Optimize audio control and ad script routines by employing dictionaries for a more efficient data retrieval process, removing unnecessary loops, and replacing public methods with private where appropriate. Default audio and ads settings are also replaced with specified keys object, improving code clarity and maintainability.

Refactor ad reward handling and display components
The previous monolithic Ads.cs script was split into an ADManager.cs and DailyTicketRewardsManager.cs to improve code cohesion and maintainability. Removed redundancy in PopupTextManager.cs, and transitioned panel manipulate commands and fluffy animation control to use a Sequence in DOTween. Changed certain print statements to Debug.Log for more professional logging.

Refactor and add new functionalities to build game
The code now conforms to the Single Responsibility Principle for better clarity and maintainability. The desire to extraction of methods and variables has led to a refactoring process, which resulted in the addition of the IMiniGame interface, a new 'GameStatus' enumeration was implemented in GameManager and methods were organized in corresponding categories. The tutorial phase was revised and methods regarding score were introduced. Moreover, the 'AudioCtrl' class was renamed to 'AudioManager' and string parsing exceptions were added to improve error handling. Changes in 'Gacha' files are related to AudioManager rename.

Remove unused Gacha_TicketsHolder.cs file and update GachaponManager.cs
The Gacha_TicketsHolder.cs script was deleted as it became obsolete. In GachaponManager.cs, the major update includes improving the animation logic for a smoother user experience. Documentation for the Converter and Localize classes has been added in MyUtility.cs for better readability and understanding of the code.
Namespace modified, comments added

Update user profile fields
New information fields have been included in the user profile section. The added fields pertain to education history, work experience, and skills thereby allowing for a more comprehensive representation of user data.

Remove game shooting scripts
Deleted multiple game shooting scripts from the project. This includes scripts for system release particles, enemy spawning, shooting AIs and mechanics, and bullet management. This major removal may significantly impact the game's functionality hence, the necessary replacements or modifications should now be considered.

Refactor Shoot game's ItemManager and InputManager scripts
The ItemManager class has been streamlined. Extraneous details were moved into more specific methods for better code organization and readability. Major changes include breaking down the item handling within the Update method into smaller, specific methods, and reordering some lines for more intuitive code flow. Furthermore, in the InputManager script, the naming and structuring of serialized fields were cleaned up for consistency. Unused imports were also removed.

Remove unused scripts and assets
The scripts and assets, that were not being used in the current state of the project, were removed. The deleted files include "DragSprite.cs", "EnergyUIFXCtrl.cs", "FootstepConstraints.cs", and "Land_GameManager.cs". This operation helps to keep the codebase clean and manageable.

Refactor and improve code throughout multiple scripts
The code across multiple scripts was refactored and improved. This included renaming certain scripts, updating function parameters, and adding new game manager classes. The commit also updated usages of audio elements to use a new audio manager class, improving performance and readability. The overall logic and aim of each script remain the same, but the underlying code has been updated to offer better performance and organization.

Remove unused scripts and rename utility class
Deleted two unused scripts: 'MoneyManager.cs' and 'Ranking_UI.cs'. Also renamed 'MyUtility' class to 'Utility' in 'MyUtility.cs' to reflect its more general usage.

Refactor codebase and reorganize directory structure
The changes mainly involve refactoring of the codebase, which includes renaming some namespaces to improve clarity and consistency. Scripts related to "Gacha", "Games" and "Core.UI" have been reorganized into new directories for better code management. This refactoring also includes adjustments to improve code readability without altering functionality.

Refactor code for readability and maintainability
Code has been reformatted to improve readability, primarily by adjusting line breaks and spacing. Changes largely encompass shifting multi-line property declarations onto single lines, and moving constant declarations to their own header, thereby improving the organization and maintainability of the code.

Refactor code for better readability and structure
This commit includes a few cleaning up and refactoring measures for increased readability, better arrangement, and clarity. Sections of code in various game scripts were repositioned for more logical structuring. The changes also include cleaning up unused constants, refining summary comments, and removing unnecessary elements.

Refactor codebase and enhance method readability
Renamed multiple scripts to improve directory structure and readability. Simplified method invocations inside 'Start' and 'Awake' functions by using lambda expressions. Additionally, the GameStatus enumeration declaration in GameManager.cs was moved to a more logical location within the source code.
README.MD UPDATE

.gitignore updated and script meta files added
This commit adds multiple picture texture meta files to the Assets/Docs directory. It also introduces meta files for several scripts located in the Assets/Scripts folder. The additions contribute to enhancing the graphics system and improving script management in the project.
preview images update
readme.md image added

Update .gitignore and refactor PetDialogueManager
.gitignore has been updated to ignore .meta files. Refactoring work was done in the PetDialogueManager class - a new enum PetScoreType was introduced at the top of the class structure, and all instances of `_type` were replaced with `type` for better code readability and consistency.

Refactor PetSurfaceMovement2D script for improved code clarity
The PetSurfaceMovement2D script has been significantly refactored to improve readability and maintainability. Large chunks of code have been extracted into separate helper methods. Also, several lines of code responsible for updating object positions and calculating constraints have been reorganized to enhance the structure and flow of the code.

Add availability checks to pet surface movement
An additional check for position availability has been added to the PetSurfaceMovement2D script. This check helps determine whether the left and right positions are available or not. This will enhance the game character's movement on different surfaces by avoiding unavailable spots.

Refactor GameManager and update asset metadata
Applied necessary modifications to GameManager.cs outlining structure and removal of unused codes. Aside from adapting a cleaner and more readable code structure, asset metadata for multiple scripts and resources has been updated. These are preparative revisions to accommodate further improvements.

Remove unused scripts and image files
This commit deletes several scripts and image files that are no longer needed in the project. The removed scripts were related to MiniGames, System, Pet, MainPage, Gachapon, UI, and Utility. Similarly, several .gif file metadata were removed from the Docs directory, freeing up space and decluttering the codebase.

MESSAGE.value:
Refactor ad reward handling and display components
The previous monolithic Ads.cs script was split into an ADManager.cs and DailyTicketRewardsManager.cs to improve code cohesion and maintainability. Removed redundancy in PopupTextManager.cs, and transitioned panel manipulate commands and fluffy animation control to use a Sequence in DOTween. Changed certain print statements to Debug.Log for more professional logging.

Refactor and add new functionalities to build game
The code now conforms to the Single Responsibility Principle for better clarity and maintainability. The desire to extraction of methods and variables has led to a refactoring process, which resulted in the addition of the IMiniGame interface, a new 'GameStatus' enumeration was implemented in GameManager and methods were organized in corresponding categories. The tutorial phase was revised and methods regarding score were introduced. Moreover, the 'AudioCtrl' class was renamed to 'AudioManager' and string parsing exceptions were added to improve error handling. Changes in 'Gacha' files are related to AudioManager rename.

Remove unused Gacha_TicketsHolder.cs file and update GachaponManager.cs
The Gacha_TicketsHolder.cs script was deleted as it became obsolete. In GachaponManager.cs, the major update includes improving the animation logic for a smoother user experience. Documentation for the Converter and Localize classes has been added in MyUtility.cs for better readability and understanding of the code.

Remove "Build" and "Jump" game scripts
The aforementioned scripts have been deleted, perhaps indicating a pivot in the project's direction. This includes main game manager for the "build" mini-game and its associated scripts which managed the building blocks, UI animations, sound effects, and game stages. The animation script for the "jump" game mode was also removed.
Namespace modified, comments added

Update user profile fields
The user profile fields have been modified to add new information. Changes include the addition of education history, work experience, and skills. This allows a more complete display of user information.

New information fields have been included in the user profile section. The added fields pertain to education history, work experience, and skills thereby allowing for a more comprehensive representation of user data.

This major removal may significantly impact the game's functionality hence, the necessary replacements or modifications should now be considered.

Similarly, several .gif file metadata were removed from the Docs directory, freeing up space and decluttering the codebase.
